Case reference: 2014002740.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 1997, Ferdinand Dauz was last seen in New Westminster British Columbia.  Mr. Dauz was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2006006499.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1972, Clifford Boyle was aboard the S.S. Gleneagle on which he was employed. He was last seen on the deck of the left side of the ship near the back.  It is presumed that Mr. Boyle fell overboard and is presumed drowned in Georgian Bay, Ontario.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, End of finger missing

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2019040207.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2015, Denis Chernov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Before he was reported missing, Denis had not been seen or heard from for four years.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2015050774.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Mazen Malik was last seen in the Sheppard Avenue West and Allen Road area in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006020199.CaseDesc: Christopher Nemmers was last seen on August 11, 1992 on the Sturgeon River. He was going to drain water from a boat and was heard calling for help, then seen slipping under the water. He is presumed drowned and his body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2016003652.CaseDesc: Shelley Desrochers was last seen on January 2, 2016 in London (ON). Police and family are concerned for her well being.

Other:
Cell Phone, Lost cell phone 
BLACK ZTE GRAND X2 Z850
S# 867239025096526 & SS 326E52104380
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Rose, Heart & blue bird

Case reference: 2014004835.CaseDesc: Ashleigh Pettman was last seen on June 3 2005 in the downtown area of Kelowna, British Columbia. She had moved to Kelowna from Grand Prairie, Alberta in March 2005 to live with her grandmother. In May 2005, Ashleigh gathered her belongings and moved out of her grandmother's residence to an unknown location.

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Ton Hian Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Ton Hian had left his home with two other men.

Coat: Dark Blue, Blazer, McGill University crest on the pocket

Case reference: 2019009156.CaseDesc: Yves Guérin was last seen in January 1991, when he left his residence in Montréal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2018063709.CaseDesc: On January 9, 1966, Jean Gott was last seen in Thunder Bay Ontario. Jean's daughter recalls receiving a letter from her in the 1960s and it had a return address of Gheen, Minnesota.

Dress: Cotton, Blue, White, Navy and white cotton dress with white nylon trim
Jacket: Wool, Grey, Grey wool tweed coat with a fur fabric collar
Skirt: Cotton, Orange, Beige cotton skirt with green and blue flowers
Underwear: Cotton, Black, Black cotton and lace bra
Scar: Left Knee, 1" by 1 1-2" scar on left knee
Right Knee, 2"by 2" scar on right knee

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014001430.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1980, Robert Wiggins was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023011080.CaseDesc: Keenan Venuk was last seen by her family in November 2017, and was last heard from via text message in February 2018. Keenan may be in Montreal, Quebec or Vancouver, British Columbia.

Scar: Unknown, Multiple linear scars on forearms
Tattoo: Left Ear, Pink music note, possible treble clef

Case reference: 2018000902.CaseDesc: Daniel Harvey was seen for the last time on December 28, 2017 in the Bellerive district of Montreal, Quebec. None of Daniel's personal items were missing from his apartment.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014004727.CaseDesc: Roger Belanger was last seen in May of 1984, in the Peace River, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2012020033.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1997, Daniel Gaulton and some friends walked into the Park Hotel in Grande Prairie, Alberta. He had called in to take the day off from his job as a security guard at a local construction site. Daniel withdrew cash from an ATM at 9 p.m. and returned home at 11 p.m.  He had a brief conversation with his roommate and left in his 1985 Chrysler LeBaron.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Head of a black wolf on an orange moon

Case reference: 2014004493.CaseDesc: Guy Deschênes was last seen in June 2004 at his home located in Rivière-du Loup, Quebec. His vehicle was also found at his home. Guy has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2008019699.CaseDesc: On April 10, 2006 Mohmud Jiwani left his residence in Oakville to attend a business meeting in Toronto. He never returned to his Oakville residence. His vehicle was later located in the Jarvis and Dundas area of Toronto. Despite an extensive investigation, no further information has been uncovered regarding his disappearance.

Pants: Dark Blue, Navy blue suit pants

Case reference: 2016017728.CaseDesc: Reid Chesney left a men's shelter in Halifax, Nova Scotia on April 4, 2016. Mr. Chesney lived a transient lifestyle and had very little communication with family members. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015044121.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1972, Allen Robert Foy was seen for the last time leaving his home in the Saint-Hubert district of Longueuil, Quebec. Allen Robert said he was travelling on vacation north in the Laurentians to go fishing. He left in his vehicle, a green 1970’s Chrysler Newport which was found 4 or 5 years later, near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021014303.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2013, at approximately 3:56 p.m., Peter Lipinoga was last seen in the area of Terrapin Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Peter was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: The last time Trevor Angell was heard from was on the 22nd of September 2000. Trevor is a truck driver who was transporting cargo from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located in Primm, Nevada, USA on 25 September 2000.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2006009199.CaseDesc: On July 09, 2003, Michael Linklater, his father and brother went to the Linklater family hunting & fishing camp; located near mile marker 115 on ONR Railroad line, between Cochrane and Moosonee. Mr. Linklater left the camp at about 6:00 a.m. on July 13, 2003, and has not been seen since. His father and brother searched for hours before going to mile marker 126 and calling the police. An extensive search in the area has failed to locate Mr. Linklater.

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Scar: Genitals, may have a surgical scar from a twisted testicle operation

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2005003499.CaseDesc: On July 22, 2002, a Caucasian male, was found in the Niagara River, near the Queenston Dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 187 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present. He may have been a smoker. He was likely in the water for a few days at most.

Hair: Brown, Shorter than collar length, receding hair line
Teeth: He has natural teeth with some amalgam and composite resin restorations

Case reference: 2013000082.CaseDesc: On April 26, 2011, Michel Petit was reported missing from his residence located in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. All his personal belongings were found in his apartment and his vehicle was parked in front of his home.

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time on approximately March 1, 1966 in Montreal, Quebec.  Yvette was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Yvette's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun, Quebec. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020086.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1993, Willard Brass was last seen in Yorkton, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Willard led a high-risk lifestyle.

Hat: Black, Red, ball cap, crest of sunsets, with horse and rider, "Black Hills South Dakota" in writing
Tattoo: Left Hand, Love (text) and 4 aces across the fingers
Right Forearm, Dagger and a heart
Left Forearm, Born to be wild 1962 (text)

Case reference: 2015056222.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2015, Robert Luery was last seen on Lake Simcoe where he was sailing in strong winds.  His sail boat was located floating around the lake unoccupied.  An extensive search of the lake was completed and Robert was not located.

Case reference: 2012020084.CaseDesc: Kenneth Kettleson was an avid hunter and outdoorsman, and he led a reclusive lifestyle. Kenneth had not been seen for two weeks before he was reported missing. His residence was secure, and his vehicle was in the yard.

Case reference: 2023046914.CaseDesc:
On August 22, 2023, Jasmine Laboucan was seen for the last time in Grande Prairie, AB.

Jasmine has a medical condition and may be confused or disorientated.

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2022055316.CaseDesc: Jesse Strongarm was last seen in November 2021 in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. At the time of this disappearance, Jesse was living a high-risk lifestyle. After communicating with a friend in December 2021 Jesse has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014047277.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2014, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Abdool Kisson was last seen leaving his ex-girlfriend’s house in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2020009578.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1989, at approximately 1:00am, Andrew Gunzinger was seen for the last time leaving his girlfriend’s father’s farm near Orangeville, Ontario. Prior to leaving, Andrew and his girlfriend had gotten into a dispute.

Case reference: 2016030725.CaseDesc: Bryan Twan was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia, on June 7, 2016.  Bryan was last seen near Quesnel's West Park Mall and has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Denim, Light Blue, Yellow Drilling Rig Logo
Tattoo: Right Arm, BEV Heart and Unicorn

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen on March 10, 1983 when he was taken to the Edmonton, Alberta airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Larry was living a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2022016834.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2022, Shawn Miness was seen for the last time doing renovations in a residence in Portage la Prairie, Manitoba. A week prior to his disappearance, Shawn’s mother passed away, and he was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020061.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 2008, Amber Mcfarland went to Smitty's lounge with her boyfriend and an acquaintance of his. There they socialized with friends for a while and then moved to the bar at the Canad Inn. They left Amber's vehicle at the Canad Inn and went to the Cat and Fiddle Bar where they continued to socialize. Video surveillance at the bar confirms that shortly after 1:00 am on October 18, 2008, Amber, her boyfriend and his acquaintance entered the attached beer vendor and purchased a case of beer. The three of them exited the vendor and walked into the parking lot. Amber has not been seen or heard from since. All of Amber's cell phone activity and bank activity has since ceased.

Purse: White, Black, Checkered or plaid pattern

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2014001966.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1976, Edwin Lewitsky was seen for the last time in Wellandport, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Edwin was driving a 1970 two-toned green Ford Galaxy.

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1995, Ms. Runningbird was seen for the last time, she was out near Swan Lake, walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Louis Cochrane was reported missing when his family became concerned about his absence as he had a history of memory loss and a history of running into the bush and/or wandering off. An intensive search of the land proved unsuccessful. A set of footprints were found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving the drilling of 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to yield any evidence. Louis' whereabouts remain unknown.

Teeth: 2 molars absent on upper right side
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Arm, Left arm in cast

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2020007968.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Aurelio Ferreira was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Aurelio was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004449.CaseDesc: Fred Johnsen was last seen on August 28, 1979, leaving his family home near Old Forest Hill Road and Eglinton Avenue West in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014000015.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2012 Allan Kinkaid was reported missing to the Calgary Police Service. Mr. Kinkaid had moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2006. He last had contact with his family in Calgary on December 25, 2009.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Other, Blonde patch, medium length

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003708.CaseDesc: John Kane was last seen March 29th, 1994, when he left his residence to go to work at the Saint John Regional Hospital. John never arrived for his shift, which was unusual for him. John was a heavy drinker and gambler. He would become depressed when drinking, and threatened suicide in the past.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm, Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014003573.CaseDesc: On October 11, 1978, George Greyeyes left from Petersfield, Manitoba on a hunting trip. He left by canoe and was supposed to return that same day. Water conditions were poor with high winds and waves. On October 12, 1978, he had not yet returned and was reported missing to police. Searches were conducted and he was never located. George is presumed dead due to drowning.

Jacket: Nylon, Brown, Quilted plaid jacket with elbow patches

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2013000085.CaseDesc: On April 17, 1994, Jose Fernandez was seen for the last time at his residence in the Villeray district in Montreal, Quebec. Following a disagreement, Jose left home in his car without saying where he was going. The vehicle was a red, 4-door Mercury Capri.

Case reference: 2022037048.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2008, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from Lake Erie, approximately one mile off the north end of Woodlawn Beach in Buffalo, New York.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Brand: Carhartt; size: small
Sweater: Blue, Sweatshirt with cut off sleeves
Blue, Pullover sweater; brand: Mountain Exxpedition

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years
